qas.question: What 3 types of philosophies attempt to correct the problem with matter and energy without removing every belief about materialism?
What is unnecessary to explain the physical world?
What is capable of explaining mind?
What is emergence the opposite of?
What three philosophies do not correct the shortcomings of materialism?

context: If <b1_0><b2_0>matter and energy<b2_0/><b1_0/> are seen as necessary to explain the physical world, but incapable of explaining mind, dualism results. <a0_0><b4_0>Emergence, holism, and process<b4_0/> philosophy<a0_0/> seek to ameliorate the perceived shortcomings of <b3_0>traditional (especially mechanistic) materialism<b3_0/> without abandoning materialism entirely.
